history.content: When in doubt, the department one is correct.
When in doubt, the department one is correct.

The list is a collection of courses that students have submitted for review, and have been approved. We're able to update our own website as courses are approved much more frequently than we're able to edit the University's Guide.

There seems to be inconsistency as to what classes are tech electives for the LSCS major. Between the CS major "guide" and the Tech Elective listing, which one is correct? I took Ling 100 to possibly use as a Tech Elective since it was on the Tech Elective list on the EECS website, but I don't see it on the CS major guide.
history.subject: Inconsistent listing of tech electives for LSCS

history.content: There seems to be inconsistency as to what classes are tech electives for the LSCS major. Between the CS major "guide" (http://guide.berkeley.edu/undergraduate/degree-programs/computer-science/#majorrequirementstext) and the Tech Elective listing (http://www.eecs.berkeley.edu/csugrad/tech_electives), which one is correct? I took Ling 100 to possibly use as a Tech Elective since it was on the Tech Elective list on the EECS website, but I don't see it on the CS major guide.
history.subject: Inconsistent listing of tech electives for LSCS
